title: Fix mismatched icons in sidebar navigation
description:
## Problem

The icons in the sidebar navigation don't match their functions or are duplicated.

## Current Issues

From app-sidebar.tsx:
- Context and Files both use  icon (duplicated)
- Embed and Extensions both use  icon (duplicated)

## Suggested Icon Assignments

Based on Lucide React icons and semantic meaning:

### Current → Suggested
- **Context**: FileText → **FolderOpen** (represents workspace/context)
- **Files**: FileText → **Files** (multiple files) or **File** (single file icon)
- **Memory**: Database → **Database** (correct, keep)
- **Embed**: Code → **Code2** or **Terminal** (integration/technical)
- **Extensions**: Code → **Puzzle** or **Plug** (extensions/add-ons)
- **Chat**: MessageSquare (correct, keep)
- **History**: History (correct, keep)
- **Admin**: Users (correct, keep)

## Available Icons to Import from lucide-react
- FolderOpen
- Files
- File
- Code2
- Terminal
- Puzzle
- Plug

## Files to Modify
- `src/components/app-sidebar.tsx` - Update icon imports and assignments
- May need to verify icon rendering in sidebar

## Related Issues
- Discovered from: aibase-yrb (sidebar reorganization)
close_reason: Icons updated to eliminate duplication and improve semantic meaning: Context→FolderOpen, Files→Files, Embed→Terminal, Extensions→Puzzle

title: Organize project navigation into proper menubar structure
description:
The current button-based UX is not scalable for the project. With the growing number of menu items, we need to organize them into a proper menubar structure.

Current issues:
- Too many navigation buttons displayed horizontally
- Not scalable as more features are added
- Poor use of screen space
- Difficult to organize related features

Requirements:
1. Implement proper shadcn menubar with dropdown menus
2. Group related features into logical categories:
   - Main: Chat, History
   - Knowledge: Memory, Context, Files
   - Settings: Embed, Extensions
3. Use keyboard shortcuts for common actions
4. Maintain current functionality while improving UX
5. Ensure mobile responsiveness

Reference: https://ui.shadcn.com/docs/components/menubar

Files to modify:
- frontend/src/components/layout/project-navigation.tsx

title: Remove unusable bottom section from sidebar
description:
## Problem

The bottom section of the sidebar (NavSecondary with Support/Feedback links) is currently unusable and provides no value.

## Current State

From app-sidebar.tsx:
- SidebarFooter contains NavUser component
- SidebarContent includes NavSecondary with:
  - Support (links to GitHub issues)
  - Feedback (links to GitHub issues)
- Both links go to the same external URL
- External links in sidebar are not useful for in-app navigation

## Proposed Solution

Remove the bottom section components:
1. Remove `NavSecondary` from SidebarContent
2. Consider removing `SidebarFooter` and `NavUser` if they don't provide functionality
3. Simplify the sidebar structure to only show useful navigation

## Alternative

If the bottom section should be kept, make it usable:
- Add in-app support dialog
- Add feedback form
- Make user profile/settings accessible
- Otherwise, remove it entirely

## Files to Modify
- `src/components/app-sidebar.tsx` - Remove NavSecondary and potentially SidebarFooter

## Related Issues
- Follow-up to: aibase-yrb (sidebar reorganization)
close_reason: Removed NavSecondary with Support/Feedback links. Kept SidebarFooter and NavUser for profile/logout functionality.

title: Fix inconsistent page containers and responsive layout issues
description:
Currently all pages do not use consistent containers, and the responsive design is broken. Several issues need to be addressed:

Problems:
- Pages do not use consistent container components
- Responsive layout is broken across different screen sizes
- Elements overlap with each other on certain screen sizes
- Scroll behavior is broken/gets stuck
- No standardized layout wrapper for pages

Impact:
- Poor user experience on mobile and tablet devices
- Inconsistent spacing and sizing across pages
- Navigation and content overlap issues
- Scrolling issues make content inaccessible

Requirements:
1. Create a consistent Page/Container component
2. Ensure proper spacing from navigation elements
3. Fix z-index layering to prevent overlaps
4. Implement proper scroll containers
5. Ensure responsive behavior on all screen sizes
6. Test on mobile, tablet, and desktop viewports

Pages to audit and fix:
- frontend/src/components/pages/main-chat.tsx
- frontend/src/components/pages/memory-editor.tsx
- frontend/src/components/pages/context-editor.tsx
- frontend/src/components/pages/conversation-history.tsx
- frontend/src/components/pages/files-manager.tsx
- frontend/src/components/pages/embed-settings.tsx
- frontend/src/components/pages/extensions-settings.tsx
- frontend/src/components/pages/extension-editor.tsx

Priority: High - affects usability across all pages
close_reason: Successfully standardized page containers and fixed navigation overlap across all 8 pages. All pages now use consistent 60px navigation offset with responsive horizontal padding. Build passed with no TypeScript errors.

title: Improve sidebar organization with logical groupings
description:
## Problem

Current sidebar organization could be more intuitive with better groupings.

## Proposed Structure

### Section: (No header)
- **Chat**
- **History**

**Rationale**: Primary actions - always visible, no label needed

### Section: Workspace
- **Context**
- **Files**
- **Memory**

**Rationale**: All relate to your project's data/content

### Section: Developer
- **Embed**
- **Extensions**

**Rationale**: Both are integration/dev tools

## What Changed

1. **Removed "Navigation"** - Chat & History are obvious primary actions, no label needed
2. **Removed "Projects"** - Was a meaningless container
3. **Added "Workspace"** - Groups content-related items (Context, Files, Memory)
4. **Added "Developer"** - Groups technical/integration items (Embed, Extensions)
5. **Removed "More"** - It's vague; if needed, consider what it actually contains and name it properly

## Implementation Notes

- Update app-sidebar.tsx to organize navMain items into logical groups
- May need to extend NavMain component or create new NavSection components
- Ensure proper spacing and visual hierarchy between sections
close_reason: Sidebar reorganized with logical groupings. Created NavSection component with optional labels. Three sections: Primary actions (Chat, History), Workspace (Context, Files, Memory), Developer (Embed, Extensions, Admin).
